Cibiru Butuh Banyak Septic Tank Komunal
06 Nov 2019, 06:35 by Retno Heriyanto
BANDUNG, (PR).- Penanganan masalah lingkungan melalui program tanggung jawab sosial dan lingkungan dari perusahaan (CSR) Kota Bandung sulit tercapai. Sedikitnya dibutuhkan 50 Septic Tank komunal di setiap kelurahan untuk wujudkan Kota Bandung 100% ODF (Open Defecation Free) atau terbebas dari buang air sembarangan seperti dicanangkan WHO.
Demikian diungkapkan Ketua Forum Tanggung Jawab Sosial dan Lingkungan (TJSL) Cibiru Asep Wawan, saat meninjau pembangunan Septic Tank komunal di 6 titik Kelurahan Pasirbiru, Kecamatan Cibiru, Kota Bandung. “Tahun 2020 hanya tinggal satu bulan setengah lagi, tapi untuk menjalankan program kewilayahan lewat program TJSL CSR belum ada satupun yang dilaksanakan,” ujar Asep Wawan, Rabu, 6 November 2019, di Kampung Babakan Desa RT 05 RW 01 Kelurahan Pasirbiru, Kecamatan Cibiru, Kota Bandung.
Padahal menurut Asep, sejumlah program yang dicanangkan memiliki potensi untuk meningkatkan derajat kesehatan masyarakat, seperti halnya pembangunan Septic Tank komunal. “Namun hingga kini pembangunan Septic Tank komunal masih mengandalkan anggaran DAU Bankel (dana alokasi umum bantuan kelurahan), yang setiap kelurahan hanya mampu diserap empat hingga enam proyek sepic tank,” ujar Asep Wawan.
Khusus untuk mendukung program Kota Bandung 100% ODF, menurut Asep, sedikitnya di setiap kelurahan membutuhkan 50 hingga 70 Septic tank komunal. “Terutama di kawasan padat penduduk maupun yang berdekatan dengan aliran sungai seperti di wilayah Cisurupan yang banyak aliran sungai dan masyarakat langsung membuang hajat ke sungai,” ujar Asep.
Sementara Lurah Pasirbiru Adad Mujahidin membenarkan bahwa masyarakat saat ini sangat berharap pada dukungan pendanaan untuk pembangunan penataan lingkungan dan kesehatan. “Seperti halnya pembuatan Septic Tank yang baru dilakukan melalui program Kotaku baru mampu dibuat dua unit,” ujar Adad.
Kendala di lapangan selain masalah pendanaan, menurut Adad, juga masalah lahan untuk dijadikan Septic Tank. “Tidak semua lahan strategis untuk dibuatkan Septic Tank karena kontur tanah di beberapa wilayah berada di posisi tebing,” ujar Adad.
Khusus untuk program DAU Bankel, pembangunan Septic Tank lebih diarahkan ke wilayah yang berdekatan dengan aliran sungai Cipariuk. Untuk satu unit Septic Tank yang dibangun diharapkan dapat menampung 10 hingga 20 KK (kepala keluarga) bahkan lebih.
Secara terpisah, Camat Cibiru Didin Dikayuana membenarkan bahwa untuk mendukung program pemerintah bebas buang air besar sembarangan (BAB) atau Open Defecation Free (ODF) di wilayah Cibiru masih menemui banyak kendala. Selain minim partisipasi masyarakat, juga minim lahan di pemukiman padat untuk dibuatkan Septic Tank komunal,” ungkap Didin Dikayuana.
Diungkapkan Didin, di wilayah Cibiru hingga kini program 100 persen Open Defecation Free baru tercapai 78,33%. Dengan rincian untuk wilayah Kelurahan Cipadung 67%, Palasari (73%), Pasir biru (85%), dan Cisurupan (89%).
Selain memberikan pemahaman kepada masyarakat pentingnya membuat septic tank komunal, menurut Didin, pihaknya dengan unsur kewilayahan membuat terobosan pembuatan septic tank bersama untuk 5 KK (kepala keluarga). “Karena wilayah Cibiru banyak pemukiman padat berupa gang dan minim lahan, maka dibuat septic tank ukuran 1X4 untuk 5 KK,” ujar Didin.
Pemerintah Kota Bandung terus kebut pembangunan septic tank komunal untuk menekan angka membuang air besar (BAB) sembarangan. Dukung Bandung 100 persen Open Defecation Free (ODF) Kelurahan Pasirbiru Cibiru bangun lima septic tank komunal.***

Cibiru Needs Many Communal Septic Tanks
Nov 6 2019, 06:35 by Retno Heriyanto
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Handling environmental problems through the company's social and environmental responsibility program (CSR) in Bandung is difficult to achieve. At least 50 communal Septic Tanks are needed in each kelurahan to make Bandung City 100% ODF (Open Defecation Free) or free from open defecation as declared by WHO.
This was stated by Chairman of the Cibiru Social and Environmental Responsibility Forum (TJSL) Asep Wawan, while reviewing the construction of communal Septic Tanks at 6 points in the Pasirbiru Sub-District, Cibiru District, Bandung City. "In 2020 there is only one month and a half left, but to run the regional program through the CSR TJSL program, none has been carried out," said Asep Wawan, Wednesday, November 6, 2019, in Babakan Village, RT 05 RW 01, Pasirbiru Village, Cibiru District, Bandung.
Yet according to Asep, a number of programs that are planned have the potential to improve the degree of public health, such as the construction of communal Septic Tanks. "But until now the construction of the communal Septic Tank still relies on the DAU Bankel budget (general allocation fund for village assistance), which each village is only able to absorb four to six sepic tank projects," said Asep Wawan.
Specifically to support the Bandung City program 100% ODF, according to Asep, at least in each village requires 50 to 70 communal septic tanks. "Especially in areas that are densely populated or adjacent to river basins such as in the Cisurupan area where many rivers flow and the community immediately defecates in the river," said Asep.
While the Head of Pasirbiru Village Adad Mujahidin confirmed that the community is currently hoping for funding support for the development of environmental and health management. "Just like making a new Septic Tank done through the Kotaku program, only two units can be made," Adad said.
Apart from funding issues, according to Adad, there are also land issues to be made as a Septic Tank. "Not all strategic land to make a Septic Tank because the contours of the land in some areas are in the cliff position," said Adad.
Specifically for the Bankel DAU program, the construction of the Septic Tank is more directed to areas adjacent to the Cipariuk river. One unit of the Septic Tank that is built is expected to accommodate 10 to 20 families (heads of households) and even more.
Separately, the Head of Cibiru District, Didin Dikayuana, confirmed that to support the government's open defecation free (ODF) government program in the Cibiru region there were still many obstacles. In addition to minimal community participation, there is also minimal land in dense settlements to make communal Septic Tanks, "said Didin Dikayuana.
Didin revealed, in the Cibiru region until now the 100 percent Open Defecation Free program has only reached 78.33%. With details for the areas of Cipadung Urban Village 67%, Palasari (73%), Blue Sand (85%), and Cisurupan (89%).
In addition to providing understanding to the community the importance of making communal septic tanks, according to Didin, his party with regional elements made a breakthrough in making joint septic tanks for 5 households (heads of households). "Because the Cibiru area has many dense settlements in the form of alleys and minimal land, a 1X4 size septic tank was made for 5 families," Didin said.
The City Government of Bandung continues to speed up the construction of communal septic tanks to suppress open defecation. Support Bandung 100 percent Open Defecation Free (ODF) of Pasirbiru Cibiru Subdistrict to build five communal septic tanks. ***
